document.docAuthor: Papáč, Vladimír, Lukić, Marko & Kováč, Ľubomír
document.masterDocTitle: Genus Neelus Folsom, 1896 (Hexapoda, Collembola) reveals its diversity in cave habitats: two new species from Croatia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Genus Neelus Folsom, 1896 (Hexapoda, Collembola) reveals its diversity in cave habitats: two new species from Croatia

heading.emphasis:
Neelus murinus Folsom, 1896 sensu Schneider
(in press)

subSubSection.paragraph: Table 4

Revision of
Neelus
specimens from Croatia revealed that this species inhabits many caves across the country. Individuals have many tertiary rods on Th. III and abdomen, 3+3 posterior manubrial chaetae (1+1 proximal and 2+2 distal) and almost smooth a1 labral chaetae (with 1 small basal tooth).
Material examined. Papuk, Slatinski Drenovac, Jarcoder, Smrečna špilja Cave, 1 ex. on slide (No. CLL 2907), 23.ix.2010, leg. A. Komerički.
Samobor, Otruševac, Stara grgosova špilja Cave, 4 ex. on slides (No. CLL 4466), 26.xi.2014, leg. M. Lukić.
Kamanje, Obrež, Hrenov grič Cave, 2 ex. on slides (No. CLL 1940), 21.iii.2009, leg. H. Cvitanović.
